title: Chunking Up and Down in NLP: Understanding the Milton Model and Meta Model
first_phrase: In this text, we learn about the concept of Chunking in Neurolinguistic Programming (NLP) and how it involves organizing or breaking down experiences into smaller or larger pieces of information. We also explore the two models that derive from Chunking, the Milton Model, and the Meta Model. The Milton Model allows for the use of vague language to allow clients to interpret it in their way, accessing both the conscious and unconscious mind. The text concludes with examples of the use of the Milton Model, demonstrating its effectiveness in changing people's beliefs and behaviors. In the next section, we will delve deeper into Performative Perdu or Lost Performative, Bandler and Grinder's concept of expressing judgment or norm without identifying the person behind it.

last_phrase: En conclusion, ces exemples illustrent comment les modèles de langage peuvent être utilisés pour communiquer efficacement avec les autres. En utilisant le Mind Reading, le Lost Performative et les déclarations de Cause et Effet, vous pouvez persuader les autres d'adopter votre point de vue et de prendre des mesures pour améliorer leur vie grâce à une meilleure communication.
